title: pairctl v0.1 MVP
description: Build the initial headless CLI orchestrator described in docs/prd.md.
design:
Key decisions (keep stable across sessions):
- Implement in Rust (clap + anyhow/thiserror) for a single fast binary and reliable parsing.
- Primary VCS backend: jj (workspace-per-run under .pairctl/workspaces/<run_id>).
- Safety: project commands default to argv arrays (no shell). Allow shell only via double opt-in (config + flag) and only for project commands.
- Truth sources: VCS diff/status + test exit codes (don‚Äôt parse agent reasoning).
- UX: doctor --fix is non-interactive, idempotent, and never uses a shell.
- Agent adapters: prompt_mode supports arg|stdin.
acceptance_criteria:
- pairctl init scaffolds config + prompts + ignores artifacts
- pairctl doctor reports blockers; doctor --fix can apply safe fixes
- pairctl run executes tdd_dual and writes step artifacts (prompt/stdout/stderr/diff/test output/summary)
- Default is workspace-per-run + cleanup on success

title: Config: pairctl.yaml schema + validation
description: Define the config schema and strict validation rules.
design: Why: config is the safety boundary and must be strict. Avoid implicit shell execution; keep parsing stable for agents and tooling.
acceptance_criteria:
- Load pairctl.yaml and report precise errors
- Project commands are lists of argv arrays
- allow-shell is double opt-in (config + CLI flag)
- Reject unknown fields by default

title: Init: scaffold config + prompts
description: Implement pairctl init to scaffold pairctl.yaml + .pairctl/prompts and update .gitignore for generated artifacts.
design: Why: reduce bootstrap friction while keeping prompts versioned and artifacts out of VCS.
acceptance_criteria: - Creates .pairctl/prompts/* and pairctl.yaml\n- Adds/updates .gitignore for .pairctl/runs and .pairctl/workspaces\n- No implicit VCS mutations (no commits)

title: Doctor: checks + safe non-interactive --fix
description: Implement pairctl doctor (read-only checks) and pairctl doctor --fix (safe idempotent fixes).
design: Why: run must never mutate the repo implicitly; doctor is the explicit setup path. Fixes must be safe and never use a shell.
acceptance_criteria:
- Detect jj + repo state and print actionable remediation
- With --fix: can initialize jj colocated in an existing git repo
- Prints exactly what changed
- Never uses shell

title: VCS: jj backend workspace-per-run
description: Implement JjVcs: create per-run workspace, capture diff/status, and cleanup per policy.
design: Why: isolation + reproducibility. Workspace-per-run makes artifacts and debugging reliable.
acceptance_criteria: - Creates workspace at .pairctl/workspaces/<run_id>\n- Captures diff.patch via jj diff --git\n- Cleanup: delete on success, keep on failure by default

title: Process runner: timeouts + capture
description: Implement safe command runner: argv-only by default, timeouts, stream stdout/stderr to files.
design: Why: avoid hangs and memory bloat; make artifacts complete and reliable.
acceptance_criteria: - Runs argv commands with cwd/env\n- Supports per-process/step timeout\n- Streams stdout/stderr to files and returns exit code + duration

title: Agents: codex/claude CLI adapters
description: Implement CLI agent adapters (argv-based) with prompt_mode arg|stdin.
design: Why: headless exec needs stable prompt injection across CLIs; orchestrator should not depend on parsing model output.
acceptance_criteria: - agents.<name>.argv + prompt_mode in config\n- Captures stdout/stderr to artifacts\n- No shell usage

title: Engine: playbook runner + tdd_dual
description: Implement playbook execution loop (steps/roles), until predicates, max iters, loop detection.
design: Why: core product loop; keep minimal and truthy (diff + test exit codes).
acceptance_criteria: - Executes steps sequentially\n- Runs tests between steps; tests_green predicate\n- Stops on max_iters/timeout/no_progress

title: Artifacts: run/step dirs + summary.json
description: Implement artifact layout under .pairctl/runs/<run_id> with per-step files and a summary.json.
design: Why: reproducibility + debuggability; enables later MCP bridging.
acceptance_criteria: - Writes prompt/stdout/stderr/diff/test output per step\n- Summary JSON includes timings, exit codes, flags, and paths

title: Tests: CLI integration + fixtures
description: Add integration tests (assert_cmd + temp dirs) covering init/doctor/run error cases.
design: Why: protect UX and safety guarantees against regressions.
acceptance_criteria: - Covers exit codes + key error messages\n- Uses temp dirs; no network\n- Does not require codex/claude installed (mock commands)

title: Add memory consistency validation to learning system
description:
## Problem

Learning system doesn't validate memory consistency. When skills/files are deleted/renamed, memories referencing them become stale - but this is not detected or recorded.

Current learning covers:
- Convention violations (code patterns) ‚Üí GuidanceCache
- Tool execution caching ‚Üí ExecutionCache
- Skill success tracking ‚Üí skill_stats.json

Missing:
- Memory ‚Üî codebase consistency validation
- Cross-reference existence checks
- Drift detection between memories and plugin.json/README.md

## Solution

Add SessionStart hook or periodic check that:
1. Parses all .serena/memories/*.md files
2. Extracts references (paths, skill names)
3. Validates they exist in plugin.json and filesystem
4. Reports stale references
5. Records to GuidanceCache as memory-staleness pattern

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Hook validates memories on session start
- [ ] Stale references reported to user
- [ ] Pattern recorded for learning (memory-validation domain)
- [ ] README.md documents new validation

title: PERF: Batch usage logging to reduce DB contention
description:
## Problem
Every OpenAI API call writes to DB synchronously.
Under load, creates write contention (SQLite single writer).

src/ai/client.py:121-148

## Fix
Buffer logs in memory, batch insert every N items or T seconds:
```python
class UsageLogger:
    async def log(self, usage): self.queue.put(usage)
    async def _worker(self): batch insert from queue
```

## Impact
5-10x fewer DB writes, eliminates contention
close_reason: Implemented batch usage logger, granular cache invalidation, and error handling middleware
